intro: Centaurea aplolepa subsp. parvula, commonly known as the small-centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies parvula is distinguished by its shorter stature and smaller flowers compared to other Centaurea species.
